blog.name: vexingbluejesters

blog.description: Though I favor Laura's characters, this is an all over CR fan blog. Mostly just to bookmark the stuff I like. Don't ask me to tag things. This blog is mostly for me. I tag spoilers the day of but not much afterward. Icon by @dyinglikeicarus on Twitter. Main blog: cinnymoon.tumblr.com

summary:
Overalls are cute and so is Jester
[Image description: A digital drawing of Jester from Critical Role. Jester is a female...
body:
Overalls are cute and so is Jester

[Image description: A digital drawing of Jester from Critical Role. Jester is a female tiefling with blue skin, dark blue hair, freckles and pink eyes, two grey horns on her head, and a tail. She is wearing denim overalls with a pink flower embroidered on the front, a grey undershirt with medium sleeves, and yellow flats. She is posed on her left leg, with her right bent back, and her left hand is behind her head. Jester has a big smile and is staring off to her left (the viewer’s right). She is standing in front of a plain, gradient background of blue fading down into white. End description.]

blog.name: luckthebard

blog.description: 30s, Queer (Lesbian), I love D&D; My brother got me hooked on Critical Role. I try but don't always tag spoilers so this account is not #spoilerfree

tags: all we know for certain is that Caduceus doesn't speak it
summary: I feel like we don’t make enough of the fact that Travis has implied multiple times that Fjord speaks Fantasy!Spanish (or at...
body:
I feel like we don’t make enough of the fact that Travis has implied multiple times that Fjord speaks Fantasy!Spanish (or at least peppers his speech with loan words from it).

So if Fantasy!German in CritRole is Zemnian, what region of Exandria do we think Fantasy!Spanish originates from? Port Damali specifically, or the Menagerie Coast more broadly? Does Jester know it too?

So many questions.

reblog.comment:
I feel like we don’t make enough of the fact that Travis has implied multiple times that Fjord speaks Fantasy!Spanish (or at least peppers his speech with loan words from it).

So if Fantasy!German in CritRole is Zemnian, what region of Exandria do we think Fantasy!Spanish originates from? Port Damali specifically, or the Menagerie Coast more broadly? Does Jester know it too?

So many questions.

trail.content_raw:
I feel like we don’t make enough of the fact that Travis has implied multiple times that Fjord speaks Fantasy!Spanish (or at least peppers his speech with loan words from it).

So if Fantasy!German in CritRole is Zemnian, what region of Exandria do we think Fantasy!Spanish originates from? Port Damali specifically, or the Menagerie Coast more broadly? Does Jester know it too?

So many questions.
trail.content:
I feel like we don’t make enough of the fact that Travis has implied multiple times that Fjord speaks Fantasy!Spanish (or at least peppers his speech with loan words from it).

So if Fantasy!German in CritRole is Zemnian, what region of Exandria do we think Fantasy!Spanish originates from? Port Damali specifically, or the Menagerie Coast more broadly? Does Jester know it too?

So many questions.

blog.name: ineffablewitch
blog.title: Mostly Void; Partly Stars
blog.description: Dragon Age, Critical Role, Art, and Writing! Bi/Ace survivor.  She/Her. 25. Ravenclaw. INFP. Follower of Artemis and Loki.

summary: Not limiting myself to only one game or campaign, CR Characters and their DA equivalents! Vex: Dorian. They both enjoy the nicer...
body:
Not limiting myself to only one game or campaign, CR Characters and their DA equivalents!

Vex: Dorian. They both enjoy the nicer things in life and put on an air/mostly embody this element of straight up not caring what people think of them. Follow their hearts – but have a well-hidden fear of rejection. Father-issues. Though I’d argue Dorian’s dad is The Worst. Counterpoint? Vex could also be Isabela.

Vax: Inquisition!Leliana. Relectuant follower of a faith that wanted to/wants to take care of people. Caring and protective of the few they love. Mischevious streak a mile wide. 

Percy: Is a little harder. He’s similar to separate characters; Sebastian, and Vivienne. His backstory and thirst for revenge are similar to Sebastian’s, and the way he presents himself similar to Viviene. Overall he’s more similar to Vivienne, in presentation as well as overall personality. Hard to win over, but ride or die.

Keyleth: Merrill! Awkward socially confused, raised in nature and primed to take over for their respective communities. Stubbornly pursue what they perceive as right, but generally kind. 

Scanlan: Zevran; flirty, mischevious, charismatic as hell. Surprising hidden depths and deep-seated desires of being wanted/loved. 

Pike: Origins!Leliana; Team mom, sweet as hell, very much in tune with their faith and enthusiastic about it. Capable of cutting you the fuck out of their life if you fuck them over. I’d argue Hardened Leliana in particular, but it goes either way.

Grog: The way Iron Bull presents himself to those, not in the know. A man who loves drinking, fighting and sex, that is nonetheless devoted to his chosen ‘tribe’ for people. Further similarities being that both are rejected from their original ‘tribe’ for choose to save someone not part of the aforesaid tribe. 

Caleb: Anders (specifically DA2, not awakening). Sad, cat loving, stinky magic users who have a vendetta against a particular govt official. Associations with fire. Both have made terrible choices for perceived ideas of the greater good, and are responsible for the loss of a loved one. I’d argue specifically Anders in Act 3 at the beginning.

Jester: Sera. Underestimated, off the wall, cheerful and chaotic pranksters who have unexpected faith. Ride or die for their friends. Artists. Constantly getting into trouble, but overall good-hearted. 

Nott: Sigrun. Encouraging and off the wall rogues that are nevertheless well armed and ruthless fighters. Both with upbringings where one felt misplaced/isolated, and both regarded as ‘lesser’ for their status (casteless/goblin). Or? Potentially Dagna. Explosion prone fish out of water.

Fjord: Varric. Charismatic team dad with unfortunate memories about their childhood. Links to an artifact that is questionable but also powerful. Try to take care of their respective found families and are haunted by failures to do so.

Beau: Carver Hawke. Younger-son syndrome to the extreme, both (potentially) of criminal background. Fighty, awkward, unintentionally abrasive. But still protective of their chosen people. 

Mollymauk; Fenris. Neither can truly remember their history and have unfortunate unknown reminders on their bodies. Tend to want to help people despite their cynicism. Clever, good actors, but also adrift in a world they don’t fully know yet. 

Cadeuces: Cole. Ridiculously insightful but also nieve. Looks general harmless/sweet but brutal/ruthless/unintentionally pretty creepy in a fight. Kind in the strangest way, and keen on helping people – as well as following a higher calling. 

Yasha: Hasn’t had enough screen time, but potentially Cassandra. Based on faith alone.

blog.description:
here for all your pikelan needs

 header image by @toriitorii

tags: a little waxing rhapsodical about gnomes this afternoon
summary: Pike’s favorite spell to watch Scanlan cast is Dominate Monster.  She doesn’t understand how it works or why it works, but...
body:
Pike’s favorite spell to watch Scanlan cast is Dominate Monster. 

She doesn’t understand how it works or why it works, but unlike most other spells he casts, there’s this moment of concentration that overcomes him. And this stern look settles on his face, as opposed to his normal manic glee or smugness or panic. Bright glowing pink arcane symbols spin around his head like a crown, shadowing his hair and eyes and nose. And when he gives an order in the spell, Pike can hear it in his voice, and some harsh guttural vibration that doesn’t even exist in real language, but some force of the spell. Then there’s this monstrous creature, usually impossibly bigger than her or Scanlan, waiting to do his bidding. 

It’s not something she sees very often but whenever she can see his determination imparted on these creatures to save them and their friends, she’s proud because she always knew he was capable of astounding things.

Scanlan’s favorite spell to watch Pike cast is Heal. 

Maybe all her healing spells, however basic or complex. He knows how it works and knows why he can’t do it, not to the fullness she can. As with every spell she casts, she does it with grace and power. She puts her hand over her symbol of Sarenrae, and a look of peace he cannot comprehend spills over her features, repelling her doubt or trepidation. For a brief moment, she becomes light. She becomes part of a force beyond this realm and in that spell he can see the her goodness come out. Both blinding light and invisible light, that falls over everyone else, healing them. 

It is amazing every time, and Scanlan has seen her heal more times than he can count. And he’s proud to know her because she can give part of herself to fix other people and that makes her magnificent.

And this stern look settles on his face, as opposed to his normal manic glee or smugness or panic. Bright glowing pink arcane symbols spin around his head like a crown, shadowing his hair and eyes and nose. And when he gives an order in the spell, Pike can hear it in his voice, and some harsh guttural vibration that doesn’t even exist in real language, but some force of the spell. Then there’s this monstrous creature, usually impossibly bigger than her or Scanlan, waiting to do his bidding. 

It’s not something she sees very often but whenever she can see his determination imparted on these creatures to save them and their friends, she’s proud because she always knew he was capable of astounding things.

Scanlan’s favorite spell to watch Pike cast is Heal. 

Maybe all her healing spells, however basic or complex. He knows how it works and knows why he can’t do it, not to the fullness she can. As with every spell she casts, she does it with grace and power. She puts her hand over her symbol of Sarenrae, and a look of peace he cannot comprehend spills over her features, repelling her doubt or trepidation. For a brief moment, she becomes light. She becomes part of a force beyond this realm and in that spell he can see the her goodness come out. Both blinding light and invisible light, that falls over everyone else, healing them. 

It is amazing every time, and Scanlan has seen her heal more times than he can count. And he’s proud to know her because she can give part of herself to fix other people and that makes her magnificent.

tags: I gave her some scars because y'know she has them lbr
summary: CRITICAL ROLE INSPIRED SIMS                                                                           [ Beauregard ] I’ll be...
caption:
CRITICAL ROLE INSPIRED SIMS
                                                                         [ Beauregard ]

I’ll be honest here I was making a completely different sim and then realized how much she started to look like Beau (it was the hair). So, I suppose here is my 3rd installment of Critical Role Sims - Beauregard. I did this really fast so consider it a first draft that I’ll definitely edit some more later (I have to find some appropriate piercings for her for one thing), especially if I ever actually put any of these up for download. We’ll see what happens.

tags: im a big Lovecraft fan can you tell?
summary: you know, I think the biggest reason I'm so obsessed with shit going on with fjord is because I accidentally made like the same...
body:
you know, I think the biggest reason I’m so obsessed with shit going on with fjord is because I accidentally made like the same fucking character way back in like 2015. maybe earlier I have no fucking clue. A human great old one warlock who is also a sailor and also orphaned and also found a parental figure in their captain and also woke up with weird magic powers after a nasty shipwreck caused by shady circumstances. Only difference is she’s pact of the chain so she has a sweet psuedodragon familiar.

Shes the first character I ever made way back when I was first getting into DnD as a whole. Her name is Merette Vide and she is the coolest and also my daughter. So yeah Fjord backstory definitely like resonates with me or some shit. Maybe I should send Travis an invoice for royalties tbh.

blog.name: criticalfic
blog.title: Critical Role fic recs
blog.description: A Critical Role fic rec blog. Submissions/requests/suggestions very welcome as I get this up and running!

title: o captain my captain
body:
o captain my captain by zemnian_nights (4,926 words)

Set around Episode 40 of Campaign 2. This is going to be a very short, sweet rec: Beau and Avantika, incredibly well written porn, very hot. I have been wanting this since Avantika showed up, judging by the author’s summary of “well, someone’s gotta write the lesbian pirate smut…”, I am not the only one. If you want to read this, here it is, it’s great.
